This is not good.I have installed it on my Samsung Galaxy S ver 2.2,but it hangs at reboot.I have to take out the battery to restart and the worst thing is... black screen on startup.It was bricked at software level.I believed it has somehow corrupted or conflicted the system files.I am thinking to flash again the ROM,to bring it back to life.Did anyone out there experience this problem..

guys sorry i've been away, i was locked out of my account because TPB said my account was hacked and some suspect torrents were uploaded. i've sorted it now though, so i will try to get on all your requests asap =)
Kenyl sorry for the late reply mate, there is really no need to reflash your phone, you could put your device in recovery mode, and use adb to push your framework-res.apk back to /system/
Thanks Thug...i'm not familiar with ADB,so i flashed to the latest rom.Thanks for tips though...nice share,mate..

You always run the risk messing the the framework Kenyl, you should always make a backup, if it happens again, just ask and i'll make you an update.zip you can flash from recovery to restore your framework =)

You always run the risk of a bootloop ect, messing with the framework Kenyl, you should always make a backup, if it happens again, just ask and i'll make you an update.zip you can flash from recovery to restore your framework =)
Thanks Thug,so far i haven't learn how to make backups,but...i will pick up the lesson soon.I am still a beginner as an android user.Thanks for your suggestions,by the way.......
